item.title: Curriculum
item.description:
I use test cases turned in by students against all other students. Students don't seem to care much about developing defensive test cases, but they unleash hell when it comes to sandbagging their classmates.

Matt Might

item.title: iddqd
item.description:
Teaching my older son lisp (Racket). Working on a Pokemon battle simulator.

John Carmack

item.title: Foolery
item.description:
The more you have CPUs the higher you scale, to the point that software execution should complete before you start writing that software (assuming you have around -1024 CPUs).

(lkml)

item.title: Innovation tokens
item.description:
It is basically always the case that the long-term costs of keeping a system working reliably vastly exceed any inconveniences you encounter while building it.

Dan McKinley

item.title: Forward
item.description:
1,251 classes have been replaced with Microsoft's open sourced ones

Miguel de Icaza

item.title: Value proposition
item.description:
At this point, a reasonable person might think the language hates us.

Bob Nystrom

item.title: Flexibility
item.description:
Design is, as always, the art of finding compromises.

Eric Lippert

item.title: "The solid, slow-moving target"
item.description:
The way that you do stability in software, like this idea that we need a very slow-moving waterfall process -- it's antiquated. It's an accident of history that it ever worked that way.

Isaac Schlueter, Javascript Jabber #147

item.title: Quality-bound
item.description:
There is no Moore’s law working your favour!

Jim Trainor

item.title: Unlinked
item.description:
Today, 1 person noticed.

(twitter)

item.title: "Schlep blindness"
item.description:
Instead of asking "what problem should I solve?" ask "what problem do I wish someone else would solve for me?"

Paul Graham

item.title: Understatement
item.description:
Microsoft was notified on Oct 13, 2014.

http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2015/Feb/19

item.title: Overheard
item.description:
Ceci n'est pas une type

Scott Wlaschin, Functional Design Patterns, NDC London 2014

(video)

item.title: Basic correctness
item.description:
if we drive the cost of a defect down to zero, then it doesn't matter how many mistakes we make. In fact, we can experiment more and make more mistakes.

J.B. Rainsberger, Integration Tests Are a Scam, Agile2009, Chicago

item.title: Magic
item.description:
We're one step away from carrying a wand around.

Jonathan Stark, Nitch #143

(Kickstarter)

item.title: Decorum
item.description:
“I’m sorry, Ma’am, I have a thing against snakes, so let me get someone else to assist you,” he said, as if he were telling the host at a dinner party, “No dessert for me, thank you.”

(New Yorker)

item.title: Not again
item.description:
Ran steam. It deleted everything on system owned by user.

https://github.com/ValveSoftware/steam-for-linux/issues/3671

item.title: Deadpan
item.description:
This is the same language that has notwithstanding as an (ignored) keyword

(comments)

item.title: Aspiration
item.description:
LuaJIT with the JIT enabled is much faster than all of the other languages benchmarked, including Wren, because Mike Pall is a robot from the future.

Bob Nystrom

item.title: Session Initiation Protocol
item.description:
But hey, one of them is now the CTO of the FCC, so writing terrible specs must be a good career move.

Michael Giagnocavo
